task.title: Troubleshooting cluster reporting problems
task.shortdesc: You can troubleshoot clusters using the Diagnostic tool.

context.p: A cluster that is not properly configured is displayed in yellow. A cluster that is offline is displayed in red. The Diagnostic tool can help you troubleshoot the problem with the cluster.

step.cmd: Select the data view for the cluster or task in question.
From the Data View widget, the diagnose tool.

info.note: The diagnose tool is only available in Data View widget in the Diagnostics tab. It is not available as an option in the data views for the Operations or System Performance tabs.

stepresult.p: A troubleshooting tab is displayed, showing the results from the diagnostic test performed on the selected entity.

step.cmd: You can save or share the results of the diagnostic test.

choices.choice: To save the results of the test, click Save.
To share the results of the test, click Send.

step.cmd: Click Close to end the diagnostic session.
